name: Chicken Cordon Bleu
ingredients: 8 thin slices cooked ham (baked or boiled ham slices may be used)
4 slices swiss cheese. cut into fingers about 1 ½ inches long and ½ inch thick
9x13x2 inch baking dish. Bake, uncovered, in a 400 degree oven for about 40 minutes, or until chicken is
1 can (10 ½ ounces) cream of chicken soup
steps: ¼ c melted butter or margarine
Skin and bone chicken breast halves. Place each half between sheets of plastic wrap, skinned side down,
and pound with meat mallet to about 1/8-­‐inch thickness. On each ham slice place a finger of cheese. Sprinkle
lightly with seasonings. Roll ham and cheese jelly-­‐roll style, then roll each chicken breast with ham and
cheese inside. Tuck in ends and seal well. (tie rolls if necessary, or fasten edges with toothpicks.) dip each
roll in melted butter, then roll in cornflake crumbs, turning to thoroughly coat each roll. Place rolls in a
golden brown. Serve with cordon bleu sauce, if desired. Makes 6 to 8 servings.
Blend ingredients and heat. Serve over chicken rolls, if desired. Makes about 2 cups, 8 servings of ¼ cup each.
